I have guarded against the divide by zero case, however, somewhere along the 
way, a ratio is being set to zero and this is not good.  Leaving bug report 
open to decide on what should be done for this.  Either, we need to restrict 
ratio values greater than zero, or we need to decide what a value of zero 
means.

I had the same problem on a recent clean
3.1 install of eclipse, with all updates applied,
on my RedHat 8 box.  Attempting to edit the runtime
parameters (via Run -> Run ...) would also throw an
exception:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jface 4 2 2005-09-09 10:59:23.295
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.jface".
!STACK 0

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite.computeSize(Composite.java:138)
	at org.eclipse.swt.layout.GridData.computeSize(GridData.java:478)

This was true in BOTH the gtk and motif installations, so it's not
just a gtk problem.

Because it was easy (the source was readily available, and it was a 
snap to import the fragment into my workspace), I hacked
SashFormLayout to avoid the divide by zero, and again to ensure the
resulting width was enough to see on the screen.  Once I did that,
I could find the far right "pane" with the run parameters, which was
crammed up against the rightmost edge, and pull it over, and update
as usual.  Then, reinvoking the tool showed no problems, and I tracked
down that the following file had changed:

/runtime-EclipseApplication/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.debug.ui/
diaglog_settings.xml

I suspect the sash weights were screwy (missing?) in the prior contents
of this file.

FYI.  /Jskud

From our SysAdmin: The issue appears to have
been a configuration file incompatibility between versions of eclipse,
starting with a new .eclipse directory and removing part of the UI
configuration under the workspace directory appears to have cleared these
issues up. This appears to be a bug in eclipse, although it may only happen
when moving between versions.
This bug appeared running RedHat 8.  Upgrading to RedHat Enterprise 4 causes the bug to disappear.  So as far as I am concerned, the bug is resolved.
